newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton steady, arrivals hit by cold weather.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton steady, arrivals hit by cold weather.

text.p: Indian cotton prices were steady in narrow trade on Thursday as cold weather and a regional poll continued to affect Punjab cotton arrivals, dealers said.
Punjab, a top cotton producer, is in northern India. State assembly elections are being there on Friday.
"New crop arrivals in the producing centres also remained low due to cold weather as well as assembly election in the Punjab region," one dealer said.
Mill demand was sluggish but limited supplies kept prices at last levels.

In spot deals Bengal-deshi was steady at 775/820 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned was steady at 1,390/1,620 rupees per maund. Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) was quiet at 11,500/11,700 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).
